Class GameGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper

            • turtle.GameGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Playground

    public class GameGrid
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener
    Class to create a container where the actors live in.

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Repaints the graphics to show any changes in the offscreen buffer. This method is automatically called in every simulation cycle (if not turned off by setRefreshEnabled(false)). Rapidly repeated refreshing by your own code may cause the graphics to flicker.

      • onConfigurationChanged

        public void onConfigurationChanged(android.content.res.Configuration newConfig)
        Called by the system when the configuration is modified, e.g. when the device orientation changes. If overridden, the superclass method should still be invoked.
        Specified by:
        onConfigurationChanged in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
        Overrides:
        onConfigurationChanged in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        newConfig - a reference to the new configuration instance

      • act

        public void act()
        Empty method called in every simulation cycle after all actor act() calls. Override to get your own notification.

      • onKeyDown

        public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Notification method when a key is pressed. Override to get your own key notification. Used when a navigation listener is registered.
        Specified by:
        onKeyDown in interface android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
        Overrides:
        onKeyDown in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the code of the key
        event - the type of event
        Returns:
        true, if the key is consumed; false, if the system function is still enabled

      • setTouchEnabled

        public void setTouchEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable touch event callbacks (also fling events).
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the registered callbacks are enabled; otherwise disabled

      • setDragEnabled

        public void setDragEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable drag event callbacks (to be active, touch must be enabled too) Because drag events may be triggered in rapid sequence, drag events are disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the registered callbacks are enabled; otherwise disabled

      • setMultiDragEnabled

        public void setMultiDragEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable multi-touch drag event callbacks. (to be active, multi-touch must be enabled too) Because multi-drag events may be triggered in rapid sequence, multi-drag events are disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the registered callbacks are enabled; otherwise disabled

      • setMultiTouchEnabled

        public void setMultiTouchEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable all multi-touch event callbacks.
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the registered callbacks are enabled; otherwise disabled

      • playSound

        public android.media.MediaPlayer playSound(java.lang.String soundResource,
                                  boolean blocking)
        Plays the given sound resource. (The following system sound resources are distributed by the ProjectBuilder: "boing_", "click_", "ping_".)
        Parameters:
        soundResource - the path name of the audio file (must have one of the supported audio format). If no file name extension is used, the resource file is searched in the 'raw' resource folder. If an extension is given, the resource file is searched in the given relative path on the sdcard (the prefix '/sdcard'/ is added by the system)
        blocking - if true, blocks until sound has finished; otherwise returns immediately
        Returns:
        the MediaPlayer reference. May be used to check the state, if blocking = false

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String soundResource)
        Same as playSound(String soundResource, boolean blocking) with blocking = true.
        Parameters:
        soundResource - the path name of the audio file (must have one of the supported audio format). If no file name extension is used, the resource file is searched in the 'raw' resource folder. If an extension is given, the resource file is searched in the given relative path on the sdcard (the prefix '/sdcard'/ is added by the system)

      • onCompletion

        public void onCompletion(android.media.MediaPlayer mp)
        Notification method called when the playback of a media file terminates. Calls MediaPlayer.release() to release all system resources. If overridden to get your own notification, call super.onCompletion() to release the resources.
        Specified by:
        onCompletion in interface android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener
        Parameters:
        mp - the MediaPlayer that terminiates

      • addStatusBar

        public GGStatusBar addStatusBar(int ulx,
                       int uly,
                       int barWidth,
                       int barHeight)
        Adds a status bar at a user defined position of the screen. If it overlaps with the game grid window, it is put on top, hiding part of the game grid.
        The method must be called in the public Playground constructor.
        The following default attributes are used:
        Text font: Typeface.DEFAULT (immutable)
        Text height: 0.7 * barHeight (immutable)
        Background color: Color.rgb(90, 90, 90) (mutable)
        Border color: Color.WHITE (mutable)
        Text color: Color.WHITE (mutable)
        Auto refresh: disabled (mutable)
        Parameters:
        ulx - the pixel x-coordinate of the upper left vertex
        uly - the pixel y-coordinate of the upper left vertex
        barHeight - the height of the status bar in pixel units (the number of pixels is barHeight + 1).
        barWidth - the width of the status bar in pixel units (the number of pixels is barWidth + 1).
        Returns:
        a reference to the created GGStatusBar

      • addStatusBar

        public GGStatusBar addStatusBar(int barHeight)
        Adds a status bar at the bottom of the game grid window where a single line of text can be displayed. The width of the bar is adapted to the width of the game grid window.
        The method must be called in the public Playground constructor.
        The game grid window is resized and displaced to give space for the status bar.
        The following default attributes are used:
        Text font: Typeface.DEFAULT (immutable)
        Text height: 0.7 * barHeight (immutable)
        Background color: Color.rgb(90, 90, 90) (mutable)
        Border color: Color.WHITE (mutable)
        Text color: Color.WHITE (mutable)
        Auto refresh: disabled (mutable)
        Parameters:
        barHeight - the height of the status bar in pixel units (the number of pixels is barHeight + 1).
        Returns:
        a reference to the created GGStatusBar

      • playgroundPressed

        public void playgroundPressed(double x,
                     double y)
        Event notification when the playground is pressed. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. Override to get your own notification. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)

      • playgroundPressed

        public void playgroundPressed(double x,
                     double y,
                     int pointerId)
        Event notification when the playground is pressed (by the first in a multi-touch event. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. Override to get your own notification. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        pointerId - the pointer ID of the touch event (always 0)

      • playgroundPointerPressed

                            double y,
                            int pointerId)
        Event notification when the playground is pressed (by the second, third, ... finger) in a multi-touch event. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. Override to get your own notification. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        pointerId - the pointer ID of the touch event

      • playgroundFlung

        public void playgroundFlung(double xStart,
                   double yStart,
                   double xEnd,
                   double yEnd,
                   double v,
                   double dir)
        Event notification when a fling event is detected. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        xStart - the x coordinate of the finger touch location (turtle coordinate system)
        yStart - the y coordinate of the finger touch location (turtle coordinate system)
        xEnd - the x coordinate of the finger release location (turtle coordinate system)
        yEnd - the y coordinate of the finger release location (turtle coordinate system)
        v - the speed of the fling (in turtle coordinates per seconds)
        dir - the direction of the fling (in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise)

      • turtleClicked

        public void turtleClicked(Turtle turtle,
                 double x,
                 double y)
        Event notification when a turtle is clicked. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. When turtles are overlaid, the topmost turtle fires the event. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        turtle - the reference of the touched turtle
        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtlec oordinate system)

      • turtleDragged

        public void turtleDragged(Turtle turtle,
                 double x,
                 double y)
        Event notification when a turtle is dragged. Empty implementation, override to get your own notification. When turtles are overlaid, the topmost turtle fires the event. Invoked in a new independent thread.
        Parameters:
        turtle - the reference of the touched turtle
        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)

      • turtlePressed

        public void turtlePressed(Turtle turtle,
                 double x,
                 double y)

        x - the x coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)

        y - the y coordinate of the touch event (turtle coordinate system)
